title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of coin using variables. She has seven more dimes than nickels, so you can represent dimes as $$n+7$$, and write nickels simply as n.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiple the number of each coin type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their coin values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{0.05}\left(n+7\right)+0.1n=2.05$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug n into the original relationship between the coins to find $$n+7$$.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 9 nickels and 16 dimes.
